to support, to provide support in order to prevent

The first letter of the Balinese language, called ha and written in the Balinese script.
the spirit or nymph of any particular place (river mouth, tree, stone, etc.)
to be, exist, ᬳᬤᬳᭀᬃᬢᬳᬧ?Ada orta apa?What is the news?,
name, ᬜᬾᬦ᭄ᬳᬤᬦ᭄ᬦᬾ?Nyén adanné?What is his/her name?
sibling ((younger) person who shares same parents),
(language) the traditional arrangement of the letters
(interrogative) what, ᬳᬤᬳᭀᬃᬢᬳᬧ? ― Ada orta apa? ― What
fine, soft, small, cultured, refined, elegant, graceful,
smoke (visible particles and vapour given off by burning
Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /i/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬶ is read as "ni").
Changes the vowel value of a consonant to /u/ (i.e. whereas ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦᬸ is read as "nu").
A letter of the Balinese script. Bearing the name adeg-adeg, it is used on a consonant at the end of a word to suppress the vowel /a/ or /ə/ (i.e. while ᬦ is read as "na", ᬦ᭄ is read as "n")
Written in the middle of a sentence, like a comma; also written between numerals to differentiate them from the main text.
Written at the end of a sentence; acts like a full stop/period (.).
